review_title: If I knew than what I know now...
job_title: Technical Support Representative in Midland, MI
pros: MyMichigan likes to hire from outside the company, some great co-Wokers at times and fair paid and PTO
cons: I work with some great people and enjoy my work (well for the most part ), but MyMichigan Health IT department - well, it's alright to work for, if you're looking for no advancement in IT, No training and no support from Managment in your career. they will promise job advancement and then lie to about it, just to keep you around. Most staff are frustrated because of the lack of support and Managment sees everyone has replaceable for the most part. MyMichigan likes to hire from outside the company, so that a plus if you are looking for a place to get paid until your next job. The pay is fair, but weight it against the stress and aggravation Maybe not that great. You can work Hard and do your best but end up hopeless and wonder why you are there at times. So, If I knew than what I know now...I would have looked somewhere else.

job_title: PCT Patient Care Tech in Alpena, MI

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Midland, MI
pros: The salary is good compared to other jobs in the area. There is a lot of customer contact if you enjoy working with the public.
cons: I was hired as a causal employee where I worked 40 hours a week for six months with no benefits. After that my status was re-evaluated and they made me a part time employee. The culture of the organization is terrible. Upper management likes to instill a fear among the organizations general employees. There is a lot of finger pointing and back stabbing. The turnover rate is really high because people are constantly being fired or quit because of poor leadership from management. There is no sense of team unity. Bonuses are based on surveys completed by no more than thirty people. Because they are always short staffed the training is not comprehensive. The organization constantly asks their employees to go above and beyond just to keep their positions while giving them nothing more than the minimum in return.

pros: it's an average place to work

review_title: Would strongly recommend AGAINST working here
pros: Compared to most hospital environments, much of the equipment is updated and it's a clean environment.
cons:
Work culture is very negative. Employees refer to the company as a "hell hole." If you've ever worked in retail, the culture is very similar with unprofessional management and staff.
Management failed to mention the "feast or famine" nature of the job, requiring a reduction of hours even though I was employed full time. There's a policy that states you'll use PTO or go unpaid. So I never managed to accumulate PTO during my time. 
On the job training is very poor. You're expected to figure it out yourself or ask; get quickly blamed for mistakes instead of encouraging learning.
Interview and email exchanges were extremely misleading about the nature of the position I accepted. 
There is no opportunity for advancement.
Raises are not guaranteed.

review_title: It's a great place to work!
job_title: Medical Social Worker in Midland, MI
pros: I enjoy working with patient's and their families with emotional/practical support and resources. I also enjoy working with the staff in my department and the positive atmosphere of the hospital in general.  I also have the opportunity to learn and coordinate with community agencies to assist patient's and their families obtain practical resources to alleviate some of the stressors our patient's encounter during an illness.
cons: There are always cons and coworkers who are difficult to work with, however staying focused on a mission of providing excellent care to the families we serve supersede the "cons" in my opinion.

review_title: I felt this hospital was very dis-respectful to it's employees
pros:
Flexible scheduling
Great co-workers
Hospital is very modern compared to others in the area
Wonderful location in a beautiful city
cons:
Low pay compared to other hospitals in the area
No benefits or paid time off for "occasional" employees
Management has their own agenda for their particular department
Dis-respect from management
They do not respect employees working two jobs

pros: Nice environment, mostly good co-workers, flexible hours.
cons: Strong arm tactics forcing employees to rate them "excellent".  Waste employees time with surveys that they don't listen too.  More than willing to water down job description/requirements if qualified applicants cost too much.  Way too many managers have no experience or knowledge of the departments they are "running".  They are more than willing to ask the employee to advance they're training/knowledge to benefit the hospital but will not reward them for the additional workload/responsibilities with any monetary rewards (pay increase, bonus, etc.).

pros: I love the community we serve at MidMichigan Health Midland.  Our patients are amazing people and it is my pleasure to help take care of them. The equipment I use is current.  Greg Rogers is an outstanding leader.  My wage compared to my position at other hospitals in the area is higher.  I choose to stay positive and demonstrate the values of the MidMichigan Health.
cons: Staffing seems to be an issue because levels are kept at a minimum.  Therefore employees burn out and high turnover takes place.

pros: On boarding was great, they seem like MMH really cares about their employees. co-workers are great to work with.
cons: Staffing seems to be an issue because levels are kept at a minimum. Been here less than 5 years and already burned out, they waste money, Love to invest more in building projects than employees, Management does not listen,  Stressful and high pressure - lack of adequate training , never question management, (they want a "yes" man/women). not much time for breaks at times when it is busy, poor planning of project ( they leave no time for testing ), not very organized at all compared to other companies.

review_title: So far, very educational yet equally frustrating due to the rapid way in which everything has to be done.
pros: The teamwork amongst OR personnel, the variety of cases, and state- of -the- art OR's. Also, Midland is a very nice place with a mix of big city and rural.
cons: As mentioned above, the rapid pace seems to take the focus away from a disciplined approach to patient care and meticulous attention to detail.

review_title: Good place to work, supportive coworkers
